column4: ok, I got hoary, security and marillat repositories, is that enough to get backports?
the backporting is patch based, not a backported package. You will get it through the normal security process
great thanks, another question, i haven't got a single update since hoary was final, I hope that's as it should be?
yes
there have been no security advisories save the ff ones, which ar a beast to do, from what i understand
okidoki, I  guess the devs and/or packageers could use a break now...
yes
but don't switch yet, breezy is mostly just a sync for sid, and is very unstable
I won't switch for a good while, but I'd like to keep track of some stuff, things like updated w32codecs and other instaleld stuff
breezy will be pretty stable by mid-may I imagine. They are building breezy with gcc 4.0, so that is the major breakage right now
is there any good way to know when updates r available?
for what?
if you switch to breezy, you swithc lock,stock and barrel
so if an x-chat update is available I will now?
without switching to Breezy?
if any update is available for any package in your system, a little red circle will appear in the top right
thanks, just what I wanted to know
But update manager will show if any installed packages have updates?
yep
such is the wonders of apt
goody  :)
I was a little afraid that it would "protect" me from updates outside of Hoary  :)
